column4: RPT-EXPLAINER-What is China's A-share MSCI inclusion on June 1?
column5: SHANGHAI  May 31 Global market research and index company MSCI Inc will add roughly 230 China-listed shares to its emerging market benchmark in a two-step process starting on June 1  a move expected to drive a surge of foreign money into the country's stock markets.

column4: Nomura gets trading licence for new Frankfurt unit ahead of Brexit
column5: LONDON Nomura  has been granted a securities trading licence for its new Frankfurt-based unit by German regulator Bafin as it prepares for Brexit  Japan's largest brokerage said on Friday.

column4: Novartis readies anti-sexism message for migraine drug
column5: ZURICH With women hardest hit by migraine headaches  Swiss drugmaker Novartis is gearing up its marketing message to counteract sexism that it worries might become a barrier to adoption of its new medicine Aimovig.

column5: * Swiss company also considering new pricing models (Recasts story to focus on Novartis strategy  adds comment from chief neurological developer  details throughout)

column4: Novartis  aiming to go toe-to-toe with Humira  wins EU panel nod
column5: ZURICH Novartis's generics unit on Friday won a European panel's recommendation for its biosimilar version of AbbVie's Humira as the Swiss drugmaker aims to take a bite out of sales of one of the world's best-selling medicines.

column5: June 1 Novartis's new migraine drug Aimovig won a key recommendation from a key European panel on Friday  helping open the way for potential sales before the end of the year for a medicine the Swiss drugmaker is counting on to boost growth.

column4: Brazil's president scrambles to name new Petrobras CEO
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO/BRASILIA Brazilian President Michel Temer scrambled to name a new chief executive for state-controlled oil producer Petroleo Brasileiro SA on Friday  after the surprise resignation of CEO Pedro Parente over fuel pricing policies.

column5: RIO DE JANEIRO/BRASILIA  June 1 Brazilian President Michel Temer scrambled to name a new chief executive for state-controlled oil producer Petroleo Brasileiro SA on Friday  after the surprise resignation of CEO Pedro Parente over fuel pricing policies.

column4: JPMorgan downgrades Petrobras shares to neutral on CEO resignation
column5: SAO PAULO Analysts at JPMorgan Chase & Co have downgraded shares in Petroleo Brasileiro SA to neutral following the resignation of Pedro Parente as chief executive officer  "until we have a better understanding of what this means for the company and its governance."

column4: Petrobras board to meet at 4 on Friday to discuss CEO successsion: source
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO The board of Brazilian state-controlled oil giant Petroleo Brasileiro was set to meet at 4 p.m. (1900 GMT) on Friday to discuss succession plans after CEO Pedro Parente tendered his resignation  a company source said.

column4: EMERGING MARKETS-Brazil stocks  currency fall after Petrobras CEO resigns
column5: By Bruno Federowski     BRASILIA  June 1 Brazilian financial markets dropped on Friday after the chief executive officer of Petroleo Brasileiro SA resigned  driving shares in the state-controlled oil company sharply downward to their biggest one-day loss in a year.     Pedro Parente  the outgoing CEO of Petrobras  as the oil company is known  quit on Friday after a paralyzing nationwide truckers' strike forced the government to lower diesel prices.      The move fueled concerns t

column4: Petrobras outgoing CEO says presence at company 'stopped being positive'
column5: BRASILIA The former Chief Executive Officer of state-controlled oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA Pedro Parente said in his resignation letter that his presence at the company has "stopped being positive" and that he will not be an "obstacle" to alternatives under discussion by the Brazilian government.

column4: Petrobras outgoing CEO says presence at company 'stopped being positive'

column4: CORRECTED-Brazil's Petrobras says CEO Pedro Parente resigns amid diesel crisis
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  June 1 Pedro Parente  the chief executive officer of Brazil's state-controlled oil producer Petroleo Brasileiro SA  has resigned his post on Friday after a nationwide trucker strike forced the government to lower diesel prices.

column4: Petrobras  Engie extend period to negotiate contract of pipeline network - sources
column5: SAO PAULO  June 1 Brazilian state-controlled oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA has extended the deadline for discussion with France's Engie SA about the sale contract for a major pipeline network  two sources with knowledge of the matter said.

column4: UPDATE 2-Hedge funds Jana  Greenlight report gains in May
column5: BOSTON  June 1 Prominent hedge fund managers David Einhorn and Barry Rosenstein both reported gains in May  signaling that some firms beat the broader stock market  which last month posted its best returns since January.

column4: U.S. drillers add oil rigs for second week in a row -Baker Hughes
column5: June 1 U.S. energy companies added oil rigs for a second week in a row even though crude prices have declined about 7 percent over the past two weeks and analysts do not expect any big changes in the rig count for the rest of the year.

column4: Canada's Nutrien auctions remaining shares in lithium miner SQM for nearly $1 billion
column5: SANTIAGO Canadian fertilizer company Nutrien auctioned its remaining stake in Chile lithium miner SQM on Friday for nearly $1 billion  the last step in meeting regulatory commitments after the company was formed in January by the merger of Agrium and Potash Corp of Saskatchewan.

column4: Toyota says to consolidate electronics parts operations within Denso
column5: TOKYO  June 1 Toyota Motor Corp said on Friday it had reached an  agreement with Denso Corp  its main supplier   to consolidate all core electronics component operations of both companies within Denso.

column5: GENEVA The European Union on Friday submitted a request for consultations with the United States on steel and aluminum tariffs announced by Washington  a first step in the WTO dispute settlement process  a World Trade Organization official said.

column4: BMW says may source more U.S. steel its auto plant after tariff move
column5: FRANKFURT BMW said on Friday it may increase the amount of steel it sources locally for its U.S. plant after Washington imposed tariffs on imports of steel and aluminum from the European Union.

column4: Volkswagen concerned by U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs  urges dialogue
column5: HAMBURG Volkswagen  expressed "regret and concern" on Friday over the imposition by the United States of tariffs on imports of steel and aluminum from the European Union  urging a return to dialogue on a transatlantic trade deal.

column5: LONDON  June 1 Payments firm Visa Inc said its systems are operating at "close to normal levels" and the earlier issue affecting users in Europe was "result of a hardware failure".

column4: Visa suffers "service disruption" in Europe - Sky news
column5: LONDON  June 1 Payments firm Visa is experiencing a service disruption preventing some transactions in Europe being processed  Sky News said on Friday.

column4: Exclusive: Sorrell tells investor his new venture is not targeting WPP
column5: LONDON WPP's former chief executive Martin Sorrell has moved to reassure investors in the advertising giant that the firm he has set up since his abrupt exit will not compete directly with it.

column4: Wall St Week Ahead-Healthcare investors weigh bets as election risks loom
column5: NEW YORK  June 1 If 2016 is any guide  pharmaceutical  biotech and other healthcare stocks could be in for a rough summer and fall heading into another round of U.S. elections.
